question:
How to make guacamole.

Choices:
A: Chop garlic, onions, and tomatoes into small pieces then add into a bowl. Cut up cilantro and add avocado into bowl. Add lime juice, sugar, and pepper. Mixed and mash until avocado is clumpy.
B: Chop garlic, onions, and tomatoes into small pieces then add into a bowl. Cut up cilantro and add avocado into bowl. Add lime juice, salt, and pepper. Mixed and mash until avocado is clumpy.
steps: Guacamole is a traditional Mexican dip made primarily from mashed avocados.
Common ingredients in guacamole include garlic, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Looking at Choice A, it mentions adding sugar, which is not a typical ingredient in guacamole.
Choice B has the ingredients garlic, onions, tomatoes, cilantro, avocado, lime juice, salt, and pepper, which are all standard ingredients for guacamole.
Since salt is commonly used in guacamole and sugar is not, Choice B is the correct method to make guacamole.
